required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sentinel™ Trial: A Prospective Study Evaluating Combined Comprehensive Genomic and Transcriptomic Profiling With ctDNA Testing for Recurrence Detection and Treatment Monitoring of Patients With Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Sentinel™ Trial: A Prospective Study Evaluating Combined Comprehensive Genomic and Transcriptomic Profiling With ctDNA Testing for Recurrence Detection and Treatment Monitoring of Patients With Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The Sentinel Trial is a non-randomized, large-scale observational trial designed to: 1) determine the accuracy of StrataMRD for predicting radiographic and/or biochemical recurrence, and 2) compare the clinical benefit of biomarker guided adjuvant therapy versus standard adjuvant therapy in ctDNA-positive participants. The study offers the opportunity to monitor participants, define ctDNA kinetics across tumor and therapy types, and identify participants with ctDNA evidence of minimal residual disease (MRD) that are at high risk of recurrence.

detailed_description.textblock: Eligible participants are those with confirmed diagnosis of a stage 1-3 solid tumor. Patients who have leftover or surplus formalin fixed paraffin embedded tumor specimens, or a planned resection within 28 days of screening, may be eligible to participate in Sentinel. Study procedures will be limited to repeat blood draws to support ctDNA assessment.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluate ctDNA's ability to detect disease recurrence as compared to standard of care techniques across solid tumors. With sensitivity being the proportion of participants with radiographic recurrence who first had a ctDNA recurrence and specificity being the proportion of participants without radiographic recurrence who did not first have a ctDNA recurrence.

Compare the clinical benefit of biomarker guided adjuvant therapy versus standard adjuvant therapy in ctDNA-positive participants. With ctDNA clearance being the proportion of ctDNA-positive patients that are ctDNA negative ~6 months post-treatment initiation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease free survival (DFS) - biomarker guided adjuvant therapy versus standard adjuvant therapy in ctDNA-positive participants
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the clinical benefit of biomarker guided adjuvant therapy versus standard adjuvant therapy in ctDNA-positive participants

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease free survival (DFS) - standard adjuvant therapy to no-adjuvant therapy in ctDNA-negative patients
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the clinical benefit of standard adjuvant therapy to no-adjuvant therapy in ctDNA-negative patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease free survival (DFS) - standard adjuvant therapy to no-adjuvant therapy in ctDNA-positive patients
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the clinical benefit of standard adjuvant therapy to no-adjuvant therapy in ctDNA-positive patients
Determine tumor types where ctDNA-based MRD informed by NGS outperforms traditional biomarker/imaging-based recurrence monitoring

other_outcome.measure: Examine changes in ctDNA levels over time as a surrogate marker for disease free survival (DFS)
Examine the correlation between baseline tissue-derived biomarkers by StrataMRD testing and changes to ctDNA levels over time

biospec_descr.textblock:
1. FFPE tumor tissue sample (study initiation collection)
2. 20mL blood sample (collection every 3 months)

study_pop.textblock: Participants are male or female ≥ 18 years of age; with a confirmed diagnosis of a stage 1-3 solid tumor; or have curative surgery or definitive therapy (e.g., chemoradiation, SBRT) planned within 28 days of consent or occurred without any current evidence of radiographical or biochemical recurrence; are able to tolerate venipuncture for blood draws; and their primary diagnosis is not glioma or CNS disease. Both the tumor tissue sample and blood sample pass the quantity and quality parameters to allow for successful MRD test result

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female participants ≥ 18 years of age;
- Confirmed diagnosis of a stage 1-3 solid tumor; or
- Curative surgery or definitive therapy (e.g., chemoradiation, SBRT) planned within 28 days of consent or occurred without any current evidence of radiographical or biochemical recurrence;
- Able to tolerate venipuncture for blood draws; and
- Primary diagnosis is not glioma or CNS disease.
- Both the tumor tissue sample and blood sample pass the quantity and quality parameters to allow for a successful MRD test result
